content: ________________________________________________________________________________ misty meadow ruffle socks _______________________________________________________________________________ serenityxknits 1 knitting in serenity misty meadow ruffle socks the misty meadow ruffle socks are knit from the top down finished with a charming rolled hem and a delicate ruffle the ruffle is added after the sock is complete making the process surprisingly simple you can even add the ruffle to an already finished sock how cool is that the original design features contrast toes heels stripes and the ruffles but you can personalize your pair however you like go bold with multiple colors or keep it classic enjoy i m so excited to see all the unique variations you ll come up with don t forget to tag me and use #mistymeadowrufflesocks so i can admire your beautiful creations ______________________________________________________________________________ size to fit a ball circumference of s 18cm/7´´ m 20cm/8´´ l 23cm/9´´ xl 25 cm/10´´ the finished socks are designed to have 10% of negative ease gauge 34 sts x 48 row/10cm 4 in stockinette stitch needles 2 25 mm us1 / 80 or 100 cm 32 or 40 inches circular needles circular shorties or dpns material main color 50g of fingering weight sock yarn contrast color 20g of fingering weight sock yarn for each sock ______________________________________________________________________________ abbreviations and methods sts stitch k knit p purl kfb knit one front and back sl1p wyif slip one stitch purlwise with yarn in front sl1p wyib slip one stitch purlwise with yarn in back k2tog knit two together p2tog purl two together ssk slip slip knit mc main color cc contrasting color * * repeat rs right side ws wrong side bor beginning of the round _____________________________________________________________________________ serenityxknits 2 knitting in serenity jogless stripes knit the first round in the new joined color on the second round lift the stitch below the first stitch of the round onto the left needle and knit it together with the first stitch of the round kfb knit into the front loop of the stitch as you normally would when knitting a stitch don t drop stitch from your left needle next knit into the back loop of the same stitch slip the stitch off your left needle ssk slip two sts knitwise insert the left needle from left to right through the two sts and knit them together through the back loops carrying yarn behind you work while knitting in the round this technique saves time by avoiding cutting the yarn and weaving in multiple ends finish the last stitch with the old color bring the new color up ready to start knitting with it now twist the unused yarn around the working yarn begin knitting with the new color that s how it should look like kitchner stitch setup insert the tapestry needle into the first stitch on the front needle purlwise and leave it on the needle
